description: With the first quarter quickly drawing to a close, here's a look back at the most popular Intel Linux news of the quarter. There's been excitement with the Battlemage discrete graphics cards with their open-source driver, early work on Xe3 graphics, AVX10.2 dropping the optional 512-bit features to make it mandatory now (thankfully!), and a lot of exciting upstream Linux kernel improvements...
title: Intel's 2025-Q1 Linux Excitement With Battlemage, AVX10 & Other Kernel Improvements

description: Samsung used to sell web cameras for their smart TVs for use with living room video chatting with the likes of Skype. Samsung no longer supports Skype on their TVs (goodbye Skype!) or these devices but if you happen to have one laying around or buy one used for cheap, it's now possible to use these Samsung TV cameras as a standard web camera under Linux...
title: Firmware Loader Makes It Possible To Use Old Samsung TV Cameras On Linux

description: Earlier this month brought the Theora 1.2 beta release coming 16 years after Theora's libtheora 1.0 release for this video codec designed by Xiph.Org for use with Ogg audio. Theora is derived from the now rather ancient VP3 video codec, but for those continuing to enjoy content in Theora format, today brings the version 1.2 library...
title: Xiph.Org's Theora libtheora 1.2 Officially Released: 16 Years After v1.0

description: Within This Week in Plasma, KDE developer Nate Graham notes the great excitement in KDE bug fixing this week/ KDE developers have lowered their HI/VHI priority bug counts down to "their lowest numbers ever numbers" in addition to working on new Plasma 6.4 features over the past few days...
title: KDE Plasma 6.3.4 To Fix The "Most Common" Crash, Other Crash Fixes Coming Too

description: The Debian release team announced that the Debian 13 "Trixie" transition and toolchain freeze began on-schedule this month...
title: Debian 13 "Trixie" Freeze Process Begins
